textList.name: TEXT_AEA_ACID_CLEARING
textList.text: Its unusual for the Acidic Growth to be found outside of their nebulae. However, it appears to have decided you're a threat and is moving in to attack!

The ship at this beacon is of Acidic Growth origin. It's unclear what they're doing outside a nebula: reconnaissance, or just lost? You don't get to ask them though, since their weapons are online and charging!

textList.name: TEXT_AEA_ACID_PIRATE_CLEARING
textList.text: There appears to be a pirate ship nearby. Be on your guard; anyone trying to hunt in Acidic territory is either formidable or deeply stupid, and in space, either can be dangerous.
"We knew anyone foolish enough to try and sneak through an Acidic nebula would stick to open space. Yield your goods, and we may let you live." You cut the transmission in lieu of a response.
Before you can take a moment's rest from the ever-present nebulas in this sector, a pirate ship appears behind you and opens fire.

textList.name: TEXT_AEA_ACID_REBEL_CLEARING
textList.text: As you arrive at the beacon, a hostile ship immediately registers on your scanners. You didn't expect to see Rebels extending their reach into the unknown regions of Acidic territory. Charge the weapons!
You jump into empty space and are relieved to see your sensors blink back to life. However, you are less pleased to see them immediately register a Rebel ship on an approach vector!
You receive a message from a nearby ship, "Looks like our intelligence was correct! You can't escape us by traveling into unknown territory... No one can hide from the Rebellion!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_AEA_ACID_ORCHID_CLEARING
event.text: It appears the orchids are taking their duty as the Acidic Growth's only ally seriously. They move in to take you out.

event.name: DISTRESS_REFUGEE_AEA_ACID_MV
event.text: You have encountered a refugee ship drifting in space. It looks as if it was fleeing the Rebel advance and ran out of fuel. Its distress beacon is active, but you're not sure anyone is on board.
You're wary of the refugees but figure it's safe to do something on the ship.
As you hail the refugee ship, an Acidic ship jumps into the system... it was chasing it off its territory, and now it has found you instead!

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_ACID_MANTIS_MV
event.text: The distress call appears to be emanating from a Slug ship caught in open space by an Acidic vessel. They contact you on emergency frequencies: "Pleassse, we'll give you all we have if you sssave ussss!"
You lock onto the Acidic ship and engage.
You move to finish what the Acidic Growth has started.

choice.text: Leave the Acidic Growth to its prize. Power up the jump drive.

event.text: You would think that the slug's greed would end at the Acidic Growth's borders, but apparently not.
It doesn't look like they can stand much more damage. After a few shots, their ship breaks apart, and you move in to loot the remains.
The Slug captain hails you: "A missstake! A sssimple misstake. Of courssse we can pay you! Ssseee? An augmentation has already been transssported." You allow them to leave with their lives.

event.name: AEA_ACID_SCOUT_CLEARING
event.text: It seems like an Acidic Growth ship, likely a scout, is at this beacon. They don't seem hostile, despite noticing you the moment you jumped in. "You, outsider. Growth, expands. Sent, on a mission, to survey. Map data, you have?"
The Acidic ship is confused, but not unprepared. It seems like they're trying to retreat back into the nebula!

choice.text: (Advanced Sensors) Share the data you collected.
(Long-Ranged Scanners) Share the data you collected.

event.text: Acidic Growth ends comms and continues on. You have some time to yourself.

event.name: AEA_ACID_SCOUT_CLEARING_REWARD
event.text: The Acidic vessel thanks you for the data and transports over some scrap as thanks.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_HIGH_PRICE
event.text: A large Acidic vessel is sitting dormant. After a moment, it hails you, offering the services of one of them in return for scrap.
You send over your scrap, and shortly thereafter a strange battle drone arrives at your ship. It appears the Acidic Growth has appropriated the technology for its own transportation.
You send over your scrap, and shortly thereafter a strange battle drone arrives at your ship. It appears the Acidic Growth has appropriated the technology for its own transportation.
Instead of replying, you power your weapons and engage the ship.
The Acidic vessel returns to its dormant state.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_MYSTERIOUS_TECH
event.text: You're hailed by a Hektar ship hiding deep in this nebula. "Hello captain, that issss one fine vesssel. However, we have sssome tech that we asssure you will make your ssship even better!"
The Slug cuts comms and slinks away deeper into the nebula.
"Enjoy! And remember, no refundsss!" The Slugs beam after having installed a strange red button on your ship.
Even though you paid the money to the Slugs, you're surprised when you find they have actually upgraded your reactor, without any tricks!

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_GUN_UPGRADE
event.text: You're hailed by an Acidic ship, "Outsider. Tests, we wish to perform. Weapon, can you donate? Combine technology, we will. Combined, we will return." You can probably get Acidic technology here, if you have the right weapon.
You send off the weapon, wondering just what the Acidic Growth will return.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_WRECK
event.text:
You arrive at the beacon to find strange wreck floating nearby.
The wreck is relatively intact. However, it appears to have been riddled with holes.
You let the wreck drift away into the nebula.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_WRECK_RWEAP
event.text: You dock with the wreck and find it completely devoid of life. There is, however, an undamaged weapon cache in the cargo hold. You bring it back and find a pristine weapon inside.
Just as you're about to dock with the wreck, a vessel jumps to the beacon. It appears to be the vessel responsible for creating this mess.
You're prepared for the attack as the Acidic vessel immediately initiates an attack on your ship.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_ORKIDS
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover an Orchid vessel lying dormant nearby. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying some special tech. If you can kill the Orchid crew onboard, the cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure the cargo by force.
The ship stays outside your weapons' range and eventually jumps away.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_ITEM

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the beacon to discover an Acidic Vessel being repaired. It appears to be unarmed and out of action at the moment. The crew repairing the ship hasn't spotted you yet.
You dock with the vessel; however, the airlock fails to open. It appears that the Acidic ship has a security system onboard. It'll take a minute to bypass...
You show no interest in the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_ACID_AEA_ACID_ITEM_TIME
event.text: You finally make it through and begin salvaging the vessel. You're surprised when you discover an orchid, seemingly trapped onboard. "Who are you- Nevermind, just get me out of here. I thought I was going to die. I think they forgot I was onboard and accidentally locked me in here. Please just take me with you."
You bring the orchid back to your ship after finishing up the salvage operation.
You finish salvaging what you can and leave the orchid behind. Hopefully, the Acidic Growth will remember it has them onboard before they starve to death.

event.name: NEBULA_ACID_AEA_ACID_ITEM_BOARD
event.text: While you were attempting to break into the Acidic vessel, the repair crew has broken into yours!

event.name: NEBULA_STORM_AEA_ACID_AUGITEM
event.text: Right in the middle of an ion storm, you find a strange shipyard. It appears to be operated by the Acidic Growth. However, they aren't hostile. Perhaps you'll be able to make a deal with them.
For some reason you have decided to attack the makeshift shipyard. Though the facility is unarmed, one of their vessels rises to meet you and defend them.

choice.text: Pay them to upgrade your oxygen system.

event.text: The Acidic Growth quickly installs the upgrades to your oxygen system, making it now capable of both healing and extinguishing fires, depending on the setting.
You decide to move past the makeshift shipyard.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_EMPTY_WRECK
event.text: A nearby Acidic vessel appears to be abandoned.

The Slugs welcome you onboard, giving you a tour of their ship. It's actually rather nice, and you don't see any illegal contraband either. They offer you a glass of juice from some alien fruit, have a toast for your new friendship, and then return back to your ship.
You turn away from the vessel, thinking that this probably isn't worth the risk. Instead you collect some supplies floating nearby.
You find the ship devoid of almost anything except for a few crates of fuel.

As you move closer to the vessel, some kind of hidden trap goes off, your engines are knocked out, and now you're dead in the water.
To make matters worse, you just manage to detect a series of large asteroids heading your way. You'll have to take them out before they get to you.

As you move closer to the vessel, some kind of hidden trap goes off, your engines are knocked out, and now you're dead in the water.
To make matters worse, you just manage to detect a series of large asteriods heading your way. You'll have to take them out before they get to you.

event.name: NEBULA_REFUGEE_AEA_ACID
event.text: Your sensors have picked up a refugee ship drifting through the system, no doubt one of many fleeing the Rebel advance. It doesn't appear to have detected you... or else it is trying to avoid notice.
You're wary of the refugees but figure it's safe to do something on the ship.
As you hail the refugee ship, a Slug ship jumps into the system... it was hunting the refugee ship for sport, and now they've found you instead!

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_BADORCHID

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Strangely, an Orchid captain hails you from an Acidic vessel. "Captain, you wouldn't happen to have any Acidic Growth with you? We'd offer a reward for you to turn over any of it to be destroyed."
You send over your Acidic Soldier, the orchids make true to their promise and exterminate the Acidic Growth inside. The Orchids send over the reward as promised.

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crewmember was immediately revived by the Clone Bay.

event.text: Although technically not murders, these orchids are abusing their relationship with the Acidic Growth to go around and exterminate them.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_PRAETOR_DIPLOMATIC

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Acidic nebulae usually house their own ships, but this time it's a Praetor vessel. You knew the Gathering is a good ally to the Acidic Growth, but what could such high rank be doing here?

They accept the hail, and an annoyed Praetor appears on your screen. "Federation? Didn't expect you here. Acidic space is dangerous for you... But i fear you don't care, considering you decided to stay at this beacon and let it devour you."
The orchid stutters, "We... we produce... Whatever, it doesn't matter. The difference is, we're on a mission. A mission that you distract us from. I suggest you move on. Your ship will thank you."

choice.text: What is the mission? You don't seem to be doing anything.

event.text: Your question pisses him off even more, and he almost starts screaming - before a different orchid pushes him off screen. "Tar'Ek, calm down. Let me talk." You hear distant shouting, but both of you ignore it. "Renegade, yes? Please excuse him, we're all a little bit riled up. You see, we were sent on a diplomatic mission to further relationship between the Gathering and Acidic Growth. The coordinates led us here, and we believe they were correct... but we're just a little bit stuck."

choice.text: Correct? There's nothing but the nebula.

event.text: "Yes, that is... the point. Acidic Growth is all around us, but we don't know how to communicate with it." The orchid scratches the back of his head. "I suppose, since you're still at this beacon, you could help us? We'd really appreciate it."
"This might work. Could you help us gather the data? We'll reward you if you do."
With your sensors at maximum power, you quickly find the correct channel and share your findings with orchid. "Thank you, this will be enough."
"Oh... that's a shame, but we'll manage. Good luck on your mission, captain, and take this for taking your time to help us."
"This might work. We'll have to spend some time translating it, though... unless you have a solution?"
Your crew sends over the databanks and explains how to use them. "Thank you, this will be enough."
"Oh... that's a shame, but we'll manage. Good luck on your mission, captain, and take this for taking your time to help us."

choice.text: Scoop up a bit of nebula gases and hook them up to a console. It'll take some time.

event.text: Together with the Orchid vessel, you gather acidic gases and send them over for negotiation. "Strange... the results are not what we expected. It looks like in separation, it lost some of its cognitive ability and memories... We'll have to find another way to talk to it. We'll reward you for the help regardless, captain."
You have time to do something onboard the ship.
You couldn't care less about their business. All you care about is scrap, and you regard senseless murder to be a valid way to get it.
You have time to do something onboard the ship

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_CHOOSE_DEATH

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You are immediately hailed by a dangerous-looking Acidic ship guarding a station. "Outsider. Intruding, in our space. Punishment, you choose. Death follows."
"Offer, acceptable." Your shield power suddenly drops and they charge.
Your shield system is restored to full power.
"Acceptable, offering." Your weapons system registers a hacking module. You hardly have time to respond before they attack.
Your weapon system is restored to full power.
"It will suffice..." Your life support is sabotaged and they move in to attack.
Your oxygen system is restored to full power.
"Offer, accepted. Punishment, will not follow." They take the scrap and leave.
"Escaping, punishment? This, won't do. Death, follows." They cut transmission and move in to attack.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_REPAIR_YARD
event.text: You arrive to find a small automatic Acidic repair yard. You could probably try to sneak in and hope it repairs you for free. It also appears like you could pay for some repairs.
You perform the transaction and watch carefully as the machines patch the hull. However, everything seems fine. Once they're complete you get ready to jump.
You prepare to jump.
Just as you think you're about to get a free repair job an Acidic ship moves out of the queue behind you and activates their weapons.
You make it to the front of the line and recieve a free repair.
Just as you think you're about to get away with it you're intercepted by an Acidic vessel from the other end of the queue.
You make it to the front of the line and recieve a free repair.
Just as you think you're about to get away with it you're intercepted by an Acidic vessel from the other end of the queue.
However the vessel just continues to fly on past you, it looks like they weren't intercepting to after all.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_ORCHID
event.text: A rogue ship awaits you at the beacon. "Laborers for cheap! We have oxygen emitters and those advanced Acidic droids, come take a look!"

choice.text: Piracy is despicable. Attack the slavers!

event.text: You attack the slavers.

choice.text: (Caretaker Crew) Appeal to the pirates' better interests.

event.text: You don't bother engaging the slaver.
"Thanks for your purchase! May your paths be blessed by whatever stupid plant god these things believe in!"
"Thanks for your purchase! May this robot thing help you in whatever you're doing out here!"
"Thanks for your purchase! May your paths be blessed by whatever stupid plant god these things believe in!"

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_SLAVER_CARETAKER_FAIL
event.text: The slavers watch your Orchid's signing in bored bemusement. "Yeah, yeah, that's great and all, but I missed the part where I was supposed to care. I'm not in this business because I give a damn about morals, if you didn't notice. If you're not going to buy something, get lost."
If you can't convince these slavers to end their trade, then you'll forcefully end it yourself.

choice.text: Change your mind and buy a slave.

event.text: You've wasted enough time here.

To your surprise, your Orchid's message seems to touch the pirates. Or maybe not... seems they're just annoyed. "Jeez, okay! I get it, you're people too, bla bla bla. I know the gist. If I'm rude you'll just kill me. I've met Renegades before. Just take the damn plant and leave me alone." The slavers unshackle one of the Orchids and send them your way. Your Caretaker sees to it they adjust to their newfound freedom.

To your surprise, your Orchid's message seems to touch the pirates. Or maybe not... seems they're just annoyed. "Jeez, okay! I get it, you're people too, bla bla bla. I know the gist. If I'm rude you'll just kill me. I've met Renegades before. Just take this damn robot and leave me alone." The slavers deliver one of the Acidic soldier to your.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_IMPORTANT_PRISONER
event.text: An Acidic Elite appears to be protecting a small Orchid Jailer. You aren't certain why, but surely something important must be kept in there?

choice.text: Attack the elite to get to the Jailer.

event.text: The Jailer ship slinks back while the much stronger Elite moves to fight you.
Not too long after the ships disappear into the nebula.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_LEADER

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You arrive at the scene to find a small Acidic vessel being chased down by an Elite Slug ship. "Outsider. Help, you have? Destroy pursuers, if you might. We will join crew."
You pickup the Acidic Leader and turn to face the Elite Slug vessel.
You fly away, leaving the Acidic vessel to fend for itself. The Acidic growth can't really die anyway, right?

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_WEAPONCACHE
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a drifting weapon cache. In the distance however is an approaching Acidic Vessel. You have enough time to fly away and avoid a fight, or you could risk the fight and grab one of the weapons.
You're able to access the cache, however you only have enough time to grab one weapon before being forced to fight.
You fly away, leaving the Acidic ship to the cache.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_ORCHID_RESEARCH
event.text: An Orchid station is at this beacon, and you're being contacted - but not by them. "Outsider, finally. Hope, restored. Help?"

You inquire on what "help" means. "Orchids, allies - but take us. Didn't ask. Negotiation, possible? We want us back." It seems like Orchids took a substantial mass of Acidic Growth and hold it at the station, but why?

choice.text: Agree to help and contact the station.

event.text: "Federation? What are you doing here?" A disheveled Orchid asks. You can see several other Orchids walking behind this one, and the whole place seems rather sterile...

The Orchid is not amused. "This is a research station, sanctioned by the Council. Topic of research: Acidic Growth and its interaction with grown weapons and ships; fertilizer efficiency enhancement. Now that your curiosity is satisfied, I hope we can part ways?"

"And why should we do that? Listen, even if the research wasn't objectively for the best of both the Gathering and the Growth, we can't go against higher-ups." It doesn't seem like they plan to give it up willingly.
You power up your weapons. The station responds, doing the same. Maybe if you make them surrender, they'll release the Growth?
The Orchid stutters. Now stuck between a rock and hard place, they decide it isn't worth the trouble holding onto Acidic Growth.

While the Orchid station transports all the tanks of Growth back to the Acidic ship, the latter contacts you again. "Outsider, gratitude. Orchids - allies. You - ally. Future negotiation, with allies, possible. Accept this." Acidic Soldiers carry over a large amount of scrap.
You decide this isn't worth it. And, isn't it for the good of everyone?.. You get ready to jump.
The last thing you want to do is piss off your allies. You get ready to jump.
You don't really know why Orchids would do something like this, but it must be justified. You decide to help them by getting rid of Acidic Growth pestering them.

choice.text: Close the comms and move on.

event.text: You don't really know why Orchids would do something like this, and don't really care. You can do something aboard the ship, as long as you keep your distance from both the Acidic ship and Orchid station.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_ROCK
event.text: You arrive at the beacon to discover a Rock ship adrift at the beacon. It's unusual to see the Rockment out this far, and even more unusually this one has ran out of fuel.
You hand over some of your fuel, The rockmen cautiously take the fuel before repaying you with scrap.
You power on your weapons and engage the Rockmen.
You fly away, leaving the Rock ship to their fate.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_TRICK
event.text: You find an Acidic vessel broadcasting the distress signal and contact them. "Outsider. This is our space. Protect, we must." Apparently the Acidic Growth has unexpectedly setup a trap for trespassers here.

choice.text: (Friendly) Explain that you're friendly with the Acidic Growth.

event.text: "We didn't realize. Outsiders, not usually friends. Compensation, will be given."

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_QUESTION
event.text: You arrive near the distress beacon's signal.
The beacon's signal is deeper into the the nebula, as you track it you pass by a pair of wrecks, both with strange burns along the sides.

Finally you find the location of the distress beacon, theres a severely damage Acidic vessel. As you get closer you're hailed by the sole surviving occupant of the vessel. "Wrecks, can you tell the amount? We can't leave without confirmation of their death."

choice.text: Ask how many wrecks they're looking for.

event.text: The beacon's signal is deeper into the the nebula, as you track it you pass by five different wrecks, all with strange burns along the sides.

Finally you find the location of the distress beacon, theres a severely damage Acidic vessel. As you get closer you're hailed by the sole surviving occupant of the vessel. "Wrecks, can you tell the amount? We can't leave without confirmation of their death."

choice.text: Ask how many wrecks they're looking for.

event.text: The beacon's signal is deeper into the the nebula, as you track it you pass by seven seperate wrecks, all with strange burns along the sides.

Finally you find the location of the distress beacon, theres a severely damage Acidic vessel. As you get closer you're hailed by the sole surviving occupant of the vessel. "Wrecks, can you tell the amount? We can't leave without confirmation of their death."

choice.text: Ask how many wrecks they're looking for.

event.name: AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_QUESTION_FALSE
event.text: "Unfortunate. Outsider, wrong. Supplies, we will take. Mission, we must complete." The Acidic Soldier quickly beams aboard and takes some of your supplies before you can react.

event.name: AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_QUESTION_TRUE
event.text: "The mission, complete. Nowhere to go, there is. We will join you on your journey." The Acidic Soldier beams aboard and joins your crew!

event.name: AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_QUESTION_FAIL
event.text: "We... can not remember..." The communications cut out and you're unable to reacquire it. You decide to cut your losses and salvage some of the wrecks while your jump drive charges.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_BROKEN_O2
event.text: You are surprised that the acidic ship, the origin of the distress signal, hails you first. "Outsider, we need help. Life support system, broken. Reward promised".

choice.text: Risk and send your crew over.
(Anaerobic Crew) Don't risk and send your anaerobic crew.

event.text: You mute them and move on. It's not like Acidic Growth can die of lack of air anyway.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_BROKEN_O2_CHOICE
event.text: Turns out, there was no risk involved: the ship is full of oxygen. You are confused, but that's when you remember Acidic Growth usually outfits its ships with life support system that spreads the growth throughout the ship instead of breathable air. Feeling stupid, you consider your options.

choice.text: (Acidic Filtering System) Suggest they copy yours.

event.text: If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it. While carrying over the changes, one of the Soldiers decides to stick with you, seeing your system functions perfectly. When the Growth is done, you receive your promised reward, too.

choice.text: (Acidic Growth) Send over your Acidic crew to reconfigure it.

event.text: Your crewmember, being of Acidic Growth origin themselves, is familiar with this tech, and reconfigures it swiftly. If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.

choice.text: (Engi) Send your Engi to reconfigure it.

event.text: Your Engi knows just about everything there is to know about technology like this, and reconfigures it swiftly. If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.

choice.text: (Engineer) Send your Engineer to reconfigure it.

event.text: Your Engineer studied all forms of life support technology, and so reconfigures it swiftly. If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.

choice.text: (Technician) Send your Technician to reconfigure it.

event.text: There's next to nothing a WI Technician can't fix when it comes to systems, and so they reconfigure it swiftly. If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.

choice.text: (Shell Mechanic) Send your Shell Mechanic to reconfigure it.

event.text: While Shell Mechanics are more known for their nanites, it doesn't mean they don't have a bunch of general knowledge. They reconfigure the life support swiftly. If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.

choice.text: (Gi) Send your Gi to reconfigure it.

event.text: Gi know about all sorts of technology, not just drones. They reconfigure the life support swiftly. If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.
You decide to not mess with their life support system.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_BROKEN_O2_SUCCESS
event.text: You and your crew mess with life support for a bit and somehow manage to make it work! If the Acidic Growth are grateful, they don't show it; you receive your promised reward and they silently fly away.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_BROKEN_O2_FAIL
event.text: All your attempts to make life support spread the Growth end in failure, and you even manage to break it fully! Now with O2 levels dropping, you have no choice but abandon the task. The Acidic Growth doesn't seem mad, but you probably should jump away from this beacon while they still process this.

event.name: AEA_ACID_DISTRESS_VAMPWEED
event.text: The origin of distress signal here is an Acidic Vessel in perfect condition. Acidic Growth usually sticks to their nebulae, so one of them staying at a clear beacon for prolonged period of time is indeed weird.
Acidic Growth responds. "Hello. Outsider."
"Oh. We are not in distress. It is." An Acidic Soldier brings a shaking Vampweed on screen. "Rescued, that one. Strange ally, orchid with teeth. Please accept. We don't want it."

"Gratitude." The moment the Vampweed steps onto your ship, they finally stop shaking, slumping from relief. "Thankyouthankyouthankyou! I was so scared they were gonna figure out I'm not a greenleaf. No idea what would happen to me! I'm glad you found me when you did."
The Acidic captain isn't surprised. "Not equipped, to quell distress? Understandable. We'll wait, for another ship."
You decide to move on. Someone else will help them.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_CIV

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You arrive at the beacon face to face with an Elite Acidic vessel. They don't appear to react to your arrival.

The Acidic Growth explains that they're hunting a vessel trespassing in their territory. This one ship has managed to evade their capture 3 times now. They hope that you may be able to track the ship down. If you succeed, there will be a reward waiting for you.

choice.text: Agree to hunt down the ship.

event.text: Despite also technically being a trespasser, clearly the Acidic Growth cares much more about dealing with this other ship. They send you the coordinates for the last reported location.
The Acidic Growth don't seem to care and cut comms.
For some reason you have decided to tangle with the Acidic Elite. You hurry to combat positions.

choice.text: It's probably a good idea to avoid them.

event.text: Tangling with an Acidic Elite is the worst thing you could do. You leave the ship alone.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_CIV_HUNT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Acidic Growth has asked you to pursue a vessel here.

event.text: You spot the ship in question slinking away into the nebula. You aren't sure if they noticed you.
The ship tries desperately to shake you, but you won't relent. At last, they give up and hail you. "Are you one of them? Please grant us mercy, we're just trying to escape!"
You aren't letting the ship go without a fight.

As they leave you notice a small hidden marking, on closer inspection you realize it's the marking of an MFK Ace. It seems like the Acidic Growth had good reason to be hunting this ship. They're gone before you can do anything.
You've lost interest in the reward, and decide not to chase down the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_CIV_HUNT_WIN
event.text: You jump as the Acidic ship comes out of its hiding place in the nebula before you can even contact them. "Mission, complete. Outsider, praise. The reward, as promised."

event.name: NEBULA_QUEST_AEA_ACID_PIRATE_TRAP
event.text: You arrive to the sight of two Slug ships in communication range. They don't see you.
You overhear their conversation and learn they're planning to raid a secret Acidic base in the area. The pair jump off and you note down their target co-ordinates.
You have no interest in anything the Slugs could make business out of. Time to move on.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_QUEST_AEA_ACID_PIRATE_TRAP2

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Location of a supposed wealthy pirate targeted by a pair of Slug ships.

event.text: You catch up with the two Slug ships and they're already carrying out their raid! One is in close combat with an Acidic vessel, the other seems to be heading for a small space cache the vessel was protecting.
Suddenly the first ship bursts into flames, and an urgent call arrives from the remaining Slugs. "We sssugest you distract the Assidic vesssel while we retrieve the valuables. Fifty fifty sssplit."
There's money to be made here. The Slugs know that. You turn on the Acidic vessel and intercept it just before they can reach the cache!.
When he sees you making for the cache the Slug captain hails: "Foolish alienss, no eye for profit. Bessst of luck to you." They jump off, leaving you toe to toe with the Acidic vessel!.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION
event.text: A RUES ship is at this beacon. They don't show any signs of hostility.
The Coalition ship responds, and you see a Slug wearing black clothes tapping away with a pen. "Oh, perfect. Fedsss, huh? You'll do. You'll do, right?"

The Slug looks at you for just enough time to make you uncomfortable. "Mercenary work, that'sss what. Acidic gasssesss are not part of Federation, or any sssane individual'sss definition of 'sssapient life'. Need to raid a convoy that passsesss through this sssector. The target is a ssship, that ssshould be captured without, erm, exploding. We'll dissstract the essscort in the meantime. Think you can manage?"
Any day you can take out one of Coalition's elite ships is a good one. You prepare for combat.
If you ignore the problem, it will just go away. Well, in this case it won't, you'll have to go away first. No, it's not running. It isn't.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_AGREED
event.text: "Good. Sssee you later." The Coalition ship transmits coordinates of the convoy and jumps away.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_IGNORE
event.text: "Predictable. We'll jussst wait for sssomeone who actually wantsss ssscrap, then." Now that you confirmed the ship's intentions do not include attacking you, you can do something aboard the ship.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_ELABORATE
event.text: "Classsified. Jussst make sssure you can get rid of itsss crew. You'll get paid, don't worry."

choice.text: (Coalition-aligned Crew) We're a Coalition ship, actually.
(Elite Coalition-aligned Crew) We're a Coalition ship, actually.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_ELABORATE_FAIL
event.text: "No. What will it be?"

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_ELABORATE_SUCCESS_BASIC
event.text: The Slug looks around, then starts tapping away with a pen again. "That's pathetic." Stops, and sighs. "Fine. I don't care. The vesssel intended for capture is a Cealaformer. If you're not familiar, it'sss a ssship that can ssspread nebula gasssesss on itsss own. Turnsss out, the ssspace mold has thossse too. To be able to sssettle anywhere it wantsss... Kind of dangerous for sssapient life, don't you think?"

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_ELABORATE_SUCCESS_CREW
event.text: The Slug looks around, then starts tapping away with a pen again. "You're not." Stops, and sighs. "Fine. I don't care. The vesssel intended for capture is a Cealaformer. If you're not familiar, it'sss a ssship that can ssspread nebula gasssesss on itsss own. Turnsss out, the ssspace mold has thossse too. To be able to sssettle anywhere it wantsss... Kind of dangerous for sssapient life, don't you think?"

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_ELABORATE_SUCCESS_ELITE
event.text: The Slug looks around, then starts tapping away with a pen again. "You actually might be..." Stops, and sighs. "Fine. I don't care. The vesssel intended for capture is a Cealaformer. If you're not familiar, it'sss a ssship that can ssspread nebula gasssesss on itsss own. Turnsss out, the ssspace mold has thossse too. To be able to sssettle anywhere it wantsss... Kind of dangerous for sssapient life, don't you think?"

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_ATTACK
event.text: Now that you know their intentions, you can't let them go. "Aw ssshucks, didn't take you for one to fight for the sssake of sssome irrelevant mold. Charge the gunsss, boysss."

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_QUEST_ACID_COALITION_2

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Acidic Growth convoy is passing through here.

event.text: When you jump in, there's already a brawl. The RUES ship is trying to lead the escort away from a weird Acidic vessel, leaving it vulnerable to your attack. You remember that if you are to engage it, you must not destroy the ship.
You prepare to secure the strange vessel.
You decide to leave the Coalition ship here to handle all this mess on their own.

textList.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_FIGHT
textList.text: At home in the nebula, you barely have time to react when an Acidic vessel emerges from astern!
A shiny new Acidic vessel appears in the nebula ahead of you. Too bad you're about to scratch their paint.
A strange looking Acidic vessel appears in the nebula. You approach cautiously, unsure of the ship's armaments. Luckily, the Acidic vessel clears the air when weapons spring out of it's hull!
You pickup an Acidic vessel approaching. It looks like this one isn't bothering with stealth and is just coming out swinging.
As you arrive at the beacon, one of the three circling acidic vessels breaks off to meet you. Prepare for battle.

textList.name: STORM_AEA_ACID_FIGHT
textList.text: The ion storm here threatens to deactivate your core systems, a fact made all the worse for the impressive Acidic ship waiting for you.
You can't help but feel at a disadvantage against the Acidic ship, it seems almost at home in this ion storm.
You arrive in the middle of an ion storm. You luckily manage to pickup the Acidic vessel lying in ambush just in time. Prepare for a fight!.

You find yourself stuck in the middle of an ion storm with an Acidic ship just a short distance away, refusing all hails. You cautiously try to slip further into the clouds, but they turn suddenly to attack!.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_FIGHT

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This beacon is embed deeply within the Acidic Growth, and as such it's unsuprising when an Acidic vessel appears from the mist to Attack.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_TEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: TEST.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_PIRATE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You're surprised to find a ship stranded all the way out here inside of the Acidic Growth, and move in to provide assistance. When you see the pirate insignia on the hull you quickly reconsider.
You prepare for combat.

choice.text: Keep your distance and hope they haven't seen you yet.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_INFECTOR
event.text: You hear a shout from your crew and come running. A strange bomb has detonated in one of the rooms on your ship, poisoning one of your crew. It appears to have originated from a nearby Acidic vessel. "Thank you for testing our weapon, please let us know when your crewmember dies."

triggeredEventBox.tooltip: Your crewmember has been poisoned. If you jump away without curing them, they'll die.

choice.text: Attack them, they might have the antidote onboard!

event.text: You hurry to man the weapons and take the antidote from the Acidic vessel by force.
"Offer is acceptable, it would have been preferable to properly test the weapon."
Luckily you're able to treat your crew. The Acidic vessel appears almost pleased by the news. "Thank you for testing our weapon, we will use this data to improve it for the future."

choice.text: Let your crewmember die of the poison.

event.text: You let the Acidic vessel know of the outcome, it appears pleased by the results. "Thank you for testing our weapon, we will use this data to improve it for the future."

removeCrew.text: Luckily you crew is cloned alive and well.

event.name: AEA_ACID_INFECTOR_DEATH
event.text: Your crew buckles over in pain, gasping for air. Without the antidote there's nothing you can do but watch them die.

removeCrew.text: Luckily you crew is cloned alive and well. Perhaps you should have waiting around to let the Acidic vessel know of the results.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_AEA_ACID_HACKER
event.text: The Slug Hackers are surprisingly rare, even in Slug territory. Despite this, you seem to have had the misfortune to have encountered one at this beacon.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_ENCOUNTER_AEA_ACID_ELITE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You find yourself deep within the Acidic Growth at this beacon. The Acidic Elite here seems to take your intrusion in their territory as an insult, and have decided to remove you from it.

event.name: NEBULA_LIGHT_DISTRESS_REROUTE_ACIDIC
event.text: The distress beacon here appears to be broadcasting through a clearing in the nebula. Following it, you come across a rogue planet drifting through the abyss. Scans indicate that something has crashed on the surface.
Wrecks aren't uncommon out here in the nebula, it isn't worth your time.

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_ACID_INVESTIGATE
event.text: You pilot closer to the planet. As you get closer you manage to make out the crater on the surface, however instead of a crashed star ship you find a strange factory. It appears however that something crashed into the factory, causing the distress beacon.

You wander through the factory, it appears that a battle of some kind once took place here, the walls of the facility are scored by projectile fire. Eventually you find your passage blocked by rubble, there's a passage around, however it's locked behind a security system of some kind.

choice.text: Use explosives to blast your way through.

event.text: Continuing on past the rubble, you notice the signs of battle are missing from this part of the factory, perhaps theres something still alive out here.

choice.text: Use drone parts to activate some nearby haulage bots to remove the rubble.

event.text: Continuing on past the rubble, you notice the signs of battle are missing from this part of the factory, perhaps theres something still alive out here.

choice.text: (Hacking System) Use the drone to hack into the security system and open the passage around.

event.text: Continuing on past the rubble, you notice the signs of battle are missing from this part of the factory, perhaps theres something still alive out here.
With no way to continue further into the factory, you return to your ship, collecting a small amount of supplies as you leave.

event.name: AEA_ACIDIC_LEADER_FIND
event.text: Eventually you arrive in a control room of sorts, and in the middle of it you find a single surviving Acidic Soldier, however there's something off about this soldier, the normally green acidic growth has turned purple, you're not sure what this means but you go over to make contact.

"Oh jeez, I hope you're not here to kill me, I swear im not like the others, I'm not here to kill any more miners." It appears there's something wrong with this Acidic Soldier, if you had to guess you'd think it wasn't part of the Acidic Growth.

"I'm not entirely sure... I'm quite confident I was the Acidic Growth at some point, but everything is weird now, there's no more of me out there, its just me, in this robot, alone..." The Acidic Soldier trails off for a moment. "Hang on, do you guys think you can help me, if you guys can spare me a bit of scrap I can repair one of the ships and head back to try and recombine with myself."

choice.text: "Sure, What should we call you anyway?"

event.text: "Hmmm, I don't think I'm quite the Acidic Growth anymore, I suppose you can call me Bill, I've always liked the name Bill. By the way, if you ever want to visit here's the coordinates to my Acidic Nebula, maybe I'll see you around there."

choice.text: Explain that you can't spare that much scrap.

event.text: "Oh, thats ok, I'll just wait for the next visitors to come by, it shouldn't be too long, I hope." You return to your ship, collecting a small amount of supplies as you leave.

event.name: DISTRESS_AEA_ACID_INVESTIGATE_BORING
event.text: Feeling a strange sense of deja-vu, you pilot closer to the planet. Alas, nothing remains but an empty factory, devoid of life.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_BILL_MEET

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: In the middle of the Acidic Growth you discover a strange ship floating through the nebula.

choice.text: You identify the ship as belonging to Bill.

event.text: Just as you're about to make contact, an Acidic vessel comes flying out of the nebula to immediately eviscerate the strange ship. The acidic vessel then turns it's murderous intent on you, prepare for combat.
You drift away and begin charging your jump drive.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_BILL_JOIN1
event.text: You move in the scoop up the Acidic Soldier, as you're doing so you notice that the normally green Acidic Growth is a shade of purple.

choice.text: You recognise the Acidic Soldier as Bill.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_BILL_HELP
event.text: "Well I'm trying to get to the Acidic core, Hopefully I'll be able to reintergrate with the Acidic Growth once im there. The only problem is that I don't have a ship anymore, do you think you can take me there?"
"Thanks! I'll upload the coordinates to your computer."

choice.text: Throw them back into the void of space.

event.text: Strangely the Acidic Soldier begins to tell you it's story, apparently it's become seperated from the Acidic Growth somehow and has been trying to rejoin it.
"Hmmm, I don't think I'm quite the Acidic Growth anymore, I suppose you can call me Bill, I've always liked the name Bill."

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_BILL_CORE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The Core of the Acidic Growth, this is the original location where the Acidic Growth formed, and as such has the highest concentration of Acidic Growth in the sector.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.
beaconType.undiscoveredTooltip: The Core of the Acidic Growth, this is the original location where the Acidic Growth formed, and as such has the highest concentration of Acidic Growth in the sector.

event.text: You've arrived at the Acidic Core, an extremely dense Acidic Nebula, the location where the Acidic Growth originally formed. It's so dense that it's hard for the Acidic Growth to guard it, they do try however.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_BILL_RELEASE
event.text: You sneak towards the densest part of the nebula, before releasing bill out into the Acidic Growth.

You watch as bill attempts to reintergrate with the Acidic Growth. Strangely the Acidic Growth around him is turning red, and even black in some sections. You're not sure exactly what's happening but it doesn't seem good.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_BILL_BOSS
event.text: It appears that the Acidic Growth around bill is dying, and you're no the only one who's noticed. Your weak sensors manage to pickup a massive Acidic vessel careening towards you. You give bill a few more moments but you're forced to scoop bill back up before the Acidic vessel runs you over.
"I can't believe it, It rejected me, I rejected me." Bill is silent for a moment. "I don't know what to do anymore, what is my purpose, why do I exist?"

choice.text: Offer bill a place on your crew.

event.text: "That sounds fun, whats our first mission captain?" Exasperated, you gesture at the rapidly approaching Acidic vessel, you wonder if bringing bill on is such a good idea afterall.

choice.text: Offer to drop bill off at the nearest populated beacon.

event.text: "Ok, I suppose I'll just have to think of something to do, maybe I'll find a nice nebula to settle down in and create my own growth, the bill growt-" You stop listening due to the massive Acidic vessel openning fire on you through the nebula.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_SHIPYARD

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've arrived at the beacon, one of the few marked locations in Acidic space. This shipyard was where the first Acidic vessels were constructed and today it serves as the main diplomatic quarters between the Acidic Growth and the Orchids.

choice.text: Pretend to be with the orchids and dock with the station.

event.text: You manage to make your way to an empty docking bay and the shipyard lets you dock, its only once you're onboard the station that someone finally confronts you, an Orchid Floral.
Surprisingly the bribe works, the orchid that confronted you even logs you in the system as visitors.

choice.text: (Orchid Crew) Have your Orchid pose as captain.

event.text: The orchid seems a bit suspicious but doesn't push it, you're able to continue moving through the shipyard.

choice.text: (Acidic Outcast) Have Bill pose as captain.

event.text: The orchid seems a bit suspicious but doesn't push it, you're able to continue moving through the shipyard.

choice.text: (Acidic Soldier) Have your Acidic Soldier pose as captain.

event.text: The orchid seems a bit suspicious but doesn't push it, you're able to continue moving through the shipyard.

choice.text: (Acidic Leader) Have your Acidic Soldier pose as captain.

event.text: The orchid seems a bit suspicious but doesn't push it, you're able to continue moving through the shipyard.

choice.text: Explain you made a mistake and leave.

event.text: You make your way back to the ship and leave the station, you'll have no chance of sneaking back in now that they know about you.
You drift away and begin charging your jump drive.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_SHIPYARD_HUB
event.text: Eventually you make your way to the Acidic only section of the shipyard. You have three options for direction, the right leads to the engineering bays, the middle leads to a control room, while the left leads to the laboratories.

You enter the laboratories, luckily they appear to be mostly abandoned, you're able to avoid contact with any Acidic soldiers. Eventually you find something of interest, A massive weapon appears to be underconstruction here, it appears almost finished, it's only missing a barrel.

choice.text: Take the weapon and search for a barrel.

event.text: You grab the weapon before searching the area for an appropriate barrel, Unfortunately you can't find one.

choice.text: Return back the way you came.
Return back the way you came.

event.text: You enter the control room, luckily it's unmanned at the moment, Unfortunately you aren't able to access anything due to your lack of authorization, you are able to see the coordinates of a transport carrying something important for an ongoing project, however you aren't entirely sure what it is.
You quickly download the coordinates to your ship.

choice.text: Return back the way you came.
Return back the way you came.
Head to the control room. (ALREADY VISITED).

event.text: You enter the engineering bays and find several ships being worked on by Acidic Soldiers, you're able to sneak your way around the edge of the room and access a small storage area, Unfortunately the only thing in storage is an Acidic upgrade package.
You grab the upgrade package.

choice.text: Return back the way you came.
Return back the way you came.
Head to the engineering bays. (ALREADY VISITED).

event.text: As you get back to your ship, you can hear alarms going off on the station, it appears that someone finally noticed your intrusion. As you undock from the station an Elite Acidic ship intercepts you.

event.name: NEBULA_ACIDIC_AEA_ACID_TRANSPORT_BARREL

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.
beaconType.undiscoveredTooltip: An unvisited location. This beacon is located within the Acidic Growth, which may be detrimental to the health of your ship.

event.text: This beacon hosts an Acidic transport. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying the special tech for the project in the lab. If you can kill the acidic growth onboard, the cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of the goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure the cargo by force.
The ship stays outside your weapons range, and eventually jumps away.

event.name: NEBULA_AEA_ACID_POWER_CELL
event.text: The beacon sits inside a dense nebula.
